Description: Sets the server name as shown in the in-game browser and, if applicable, the Steam browser
If enabled, the server will be visible in the in-game browser (Steam-enabled servers are always visible in the Steam server browser)
Sets the description displayed in the in-game browser. Use "\n" to create a new line in the description
Sets the password for players to connect to the server. Default is no password
Sets the in-game "admin" user password (not the server password). Set before first running the server, or you will be prompted to do so in the console
Sets the password to connect to RCON. Default is a random, strong password

DefaultValue: Welcome to Project Zomboid Multiplayer! <LINE> <LINE> To interact with the Chat panel: press Tab, T, or Enter. <LINE> <LINE> The Tab key will change the target stream of the message. <LINE> <LINE> Global Streams: /all <LINE> Local Streams: /say, /yell <LINE> Special Streams: /whisper, /safehouse, /faction. <LINE> <LINE> Press the Up arrow to cycle through your message history. Click the Gear icon to customize chat. <LINE> <LINE> Happy surviving!
Description: Sets the first welcome message visible in the chat panel, which is displayed immediately after player login. Use <LINE> to create a separate line, and colour formatting like <RGB:1,0,0> to colour the text
Sets the maximum number of players that may be on the server at one time (excluding admins). Player counts above 32 will potentially result in poor map streaming and desync
If enabled, players may join the server without already being included in the whitelist. Otherwise, admins must manually create username/password combinations
Automatically add unknown usernames to the whitelist when players join (for open servers). Players will supply their own username/password on joining
If set, player accounts will be removed from the whitelist after death. This prevents players creating a new character after death on non-open servers
If set, clients whose game files don't match the server's file will be kicked
If set, login will be denied on an overloaded server
If set, the login queue will be enabled
Sets the connection timeout for the login queue
Sets Java's maximum heap size
The default Java garbage collection algorithm is ZGC, but G1GC can be selected for older Windows versions that cannot use ZGC
If set, enables the Steam VAC system
Enable Steam integration
Semi-colon separated list of maps to load on the server. ONE LINE ONLY!
Semi-colon separated list of mod IDs (eg 67commando;86oshkoshP19A) to load. ONE LINE ONLY! To install them, the workshop IDs for the mods also need to be added to Install Workshop Items

Semi-colon separated list of IDs of workshop items (eg 2478247379;2566953935) to install. ONE LINE ONLY! To load them, the mod IDs also need to be added to Load Mods. NOTE: Don't use "Steam workshop items" under SteamCMD and Updates
If enabled, displays players' usernames above their heads in-game
If enabled, displays players' first and last names above their heads in-game instead of usernames
If enabled, players will have to mouse over someone to see their display name
DisplayName: Require Mouse Over To See Display Name

Description: If enabled, allows the use of non-ASCII (cyrillic etc) characters in usernames
Sets the limit on the number of different accounts a single Steam user may create on the server
If set, allows co-op/splitscreen players
Sets whether steam usernames and avatars are visible in the player list
If enabled, game time stops when there are no players online
Sets the ping limit before a player is kicked from the server. 100 = disabled
Sets the real-world time between each automatic save of loaded parts of the map. 0 = never. (The map is usually saved only after clients leave a loaded area)
Sets the number of backups to keep
If enable, backups will be taken on server start
If set, backups will be taken on version change
Sets the period between backups. 0 = disabled
Sets the IP from which the server is broadcast. Useful for network configurations with multiple IP addresses such as server farms

Semicolon-separated list of commands that will not be written to the cmd.txt server log. Example: -vehicle. Inputting * means do NOT write any vehicle command. Inputting +vehicle.installPart means DO write that command
Semicolon-separated list of actions that will be written to the ClientActionLogs.txt server log
If enabled, changes in player perk levels will be tracked in the PerkLog.txt server log
If enabled, the server will attempt to configure automatic port forwarding on a compatible router
Additional Java arguments (not server arguments) as startup parameters that are not otherwise set by AMP. Use with care
Server name as stored locally. WARNING: Do not change unless you know what you are doing! Also update the server if this is changed
Additional server arguments (not Java arguments) as startup parameters that are not otherwise set by AMP. Use with care
Sets the spawn point for every new player. Default is 0,0,0. [Find desired coordinates](https://map.projectzomboid.com/)
Comma-separated list of item types that new players spawn with
If set, players will be able to respawn in-game at the coordinates where they died
DisplayName: Enable Player Respawn At Death Coordinates

Description: If set, players will be allowed to respawn in-game at a split screen / Remote Play player's location
DisplayName: Enable Player Respawn At Other's Location

Description: If enabled, players can hurt and kill other players
If enabled, allows players to enter and leave PvP mode on an individual basis. A player can only hurt another player when at least one of them is in PvP mode. Requires "Allow PvP" to be enabled
If enabled, displays a skull icon above the heads of players who have entered PvP mode
Sets the time taken for a player to enter and leave PvP mode
Sets the delay before a player can enter or leave PvP mode again, having recently done so
If enabled, players can hit again when struck by another player
DisplayName: Enable PvP Melee While Hit Reaction

Description: Sets the damage multiplier for PvP melee attacks
Sets the damage multiplier for PvP ranged attacks
If enabled, factions can be created and used
Number of in-game days that a player must survive for before they can create a faction
Sets the number of players required as faction members before the faction owner can create a group tag
Sets how long nighttime lasts depending on daytime: 0.5 means twice as long, 2 means half the normal time
If enabled, fires are not allowed (except campfires). Enable if fires cause problems for your server
If enabled, a global message is displayed in the chat when a player dies
Sets the number of in-game minutes it takes to read one page of a book
Sets the in-game hours after which all containers that have been looted at least once will respawn loot. 0 = never. Loot respawn is not impacted by visibility or subsequent looting
Sets the maximum number of items that containers can hold to be allowed to respawn. If the number of items is less than or equal to the number set, loot will respawn
Sets the maximum number of items that can be placed in a container. Includes individual small items like nails. 0 = no limit
If enabled, items will not respawn in buildings that players have barricaded or built in
If enabled, both admins and players can claim safehouses
If enabled, only admins can claim safehouses
If set, disables a safehouse when a member of the safehouse is connected, so that it acts like a normal house and is only secure when players are offline
If enabled, non-members can enter a safehouse without being invited
[Backup setting given typo in config key, to future proof for correction]
If enabled, safehouses can be damaged by fire
If enabled, non-members can loot safehouses
If enabled, players will respawn in a safehouse they were a member of before death
Sets the number of in-game days that a player must survive for before they can claim a safehouse
Players are automatically removed from a safehouse they have not visited for this many real-time hours
If enabled, players can claim non-residential buildings
If enabled, players can destroy world objects with sledgehammers
If enabled, players can destroy world objects with sledgehammers only in their safehouse. Requires "Allow Sledgehammer Destruction" to be enabled
If enabled, players that appear to be moving faster than is possible will be kicked. May be buggy - use with caution
Sets the speed limit for players
If enabled, players are allowed to sleep when tired, but do not need to
If enabled, players become tired and need to sleep. Requires "Allow Sleep" to be enabled
Sets how fast time passes while players sleep
If set, players can be knocked down
If enabled, players will bump (and knock over) other players when running through them
If enabled, players that can't be seen will be automatically hidden (like zombies)
If set, players in sneak mode will be hidden from other players
DisplayName: Hide From Other Players In Sneak Mode

Description: If enabled, when 'HoursForCorpseRemoval' triggers, it will also remove player’s corpses from the ground
DisplayName: Remove Player Corpses On Corpse Removal

Description: Sets the number of days before old blood splats are removed. Removal happens when map chunks are loaded. 0 = splats never disappear
If set, enables the global sound for ban and kick messages
If enabled, players can use the 'delete all' button on bins
Modifies the range of zombie attraction to cars. Lower values can help lag
Controls the display of remote players on the in-game map
If enabled, players can communicate with everyone (using the /all command in chat)
Sets the enabled chat streams for different message targets. Options: s (say), r (radio), a (all), w (whisper), y (yell), sh (safehouse), f (faction), all
If set, VOIP will be enabled
Sets the minimum tile distance over which VOIP sounds can be heard
Sets the maximum tile distance over which VOIP sounds can be heard
If set, enables directional audio for VOIP
If set, disables radio transmissions from players with a 'staff' access level
If set, disables radio transmissions from players with an 'admin' access level
If set, disables radio transmissions from players with a 'gm' access level
If set, disables radio transmissions from players with an 'overseer' access level
If set, disables radio transmissions from players with a 'moderator' access level
Disable radio transmissions from invisible players
If enabled, allows global text chat integration with a Discord channel. Requires a valid bot token to be set under "Discord Token"
Sets the bot token to access the Discord servers
Sets the name of the Discord channel to integrate with. Use "Discord ID" if this does not work
Sets the ID of the Discord channel to integrate with. Use this if "Discord Channel" does not work
If enabled, allows beta branches (branches other than "public") to be installed. Specify the branch under "Selected Beta Branch". NOTE: Update the server after switching branches!

[Beta branch](https://steamdb.info/app/380870/depots/) to install. Requires "Enable Beta Branch" to be enabled. Set any required password under "Beta Password". NOTE: Update the server after switching branches!
